page.title: 02THE GEOGRAPHY OF BRUTON AREA
page.content: The main land use in this area is for the majority,dairy farming.Some farmers have changed to beef farming and the Mill on the Brue activities centre,has replaced farming.In the area around Castle Cary, vineyards have replaced the dairy farming.The old houses of this area are mainly built from Inferior Oolitic Limestone,the newer ones are built from Faced Breeze-Blocks,the faced surface is made from Ham-stone or Cotswold-stone.The climate is suited for grass,so dairy farming is practised.The land relief of the area is undulating,due to two rivers cutting or dissecting a Limestone Plateau,which we are living over.The rivers are non-existent at the present.
